Even if I had a tablet or ipod touch I still would not waste all that space on them just for these tiny size lower than 4 gig rips.

If I watched this on my 17 inch laptop it would not compare to the rips I got that are 4 gigs or higher. I would not even bother with watching any rips on smaller screen. I am not a teeny bopper, maybe that all that downloads these little teensy weensy tiny video files.

while MPC or VLC would play the subtitles, my Roku would not.  It turned out the problem was that on 6 or 8 random lines, there was a code
"GlowGaze.Com" inserted, followed by about 25 blank lines, between the subtitle number and time, and the text for the line.  Once these were edited out, the subtitles worked properly.

While VLC or MPC would play the subtitles, my Roku would not.  This turned out to be due to the random insertion in about 8 lines, of a fontcolor code, followed by about 25 blank lines, between the subtitle number and timing, and the dialog for the line.  After removing the codes and blank lines, the subtitles worked properly.
works! Thank you
